db.juhaku.juhakudb.core.android.transaction

Class TransactionTemplate<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • db.juhaku.juhakudb.core.android.transaction.TransactionTemplate<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DeleteTransactionTemplate, QueryTransactionTemplate, StoreTransactionTemplate

    public abstract class TransactionTemplate<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by juha on 12/05/16.

    General level abstract transaction template for executing queries of all sorts in database.

    Since:
    1.0.2

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public final void execute()
        This method will execute the query inside a transaction against database. Do not call this method as it is called automatically.

        This method will call onTransaction() that should be implemented by child transaction template to provide action that is performed against database.
        Since:
        1.0.2

      • getResult

        public final T getResult()
        Get the result of query if it was set.
        Returns:
        result of the query.
        Since:
        1.0.2

        Since:
        1.0.2

        Parameters:

        public final void setProcessor(QueryProcessor processor)

      • resolveIdColumn

        public static final java.lang.String resolveIdColumn(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Resolve id column name of given class. Class must be used as an entity for database. If name cannot be resolved mapping exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        clazz - Class to resolve id column name for.
        Returns:
        String value of id column name if found; otherwise will be null. If name cannot ber resolved an mapping exception will be thrown.
        Since:
        1.0.2

      • resolveTableName

        public static final java.lang.String resolveTableName(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Resolve table name of given class. Class must be used as an entity for database. If name cannot be resolved mapping exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        clazz - Class to resolve table name for.
        Returns:
        String value of table name if found; otherwise will be null. If name cannot ber resolved an mapping exception will be thrown.
        Since:
        1.0.2
